Yes. The only Python version requirement is >= 3.5.

I followed the [maintainer knowledge base on conda-forge.org](https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/knowledge_base.html#noarch-builds) which mentions explicitly as noarch requirement:
> No skips except for python version. If the recipe is py3 only, remove skip statement and add version constraint on python in host and run section.

I removed the skip statement and added version constraints here:

https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/blob/e9c968f236e38e620252a0ccec7cc19f88a6981c/recipes/blend_modes/meta.yaml#L17-L25

  noarch: python
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"
